Settings.Name: Dice size, for loot generation determination
Settings.Description: The maximum number can be generated for dice roll by logarithmic scale, the actual number is 10^(Dice size).

Settings.Name: Uncommon drop rate
Settings.Description: The general chance of dropping an uncommon item while looting

Settings.Name: Rare drop rate
Settings.Description: The general chance of dropping a rare item while looting.

Settings.Name: Very rare drop rate
Settings.Description: The general chance of dropping a very rare item while looting.

Settings.Name: Legendary drop rate
Settings.Description: The general chance of dropping a legendary item while looting.

Settings.Name: Give REL-inserted loot priority
Settings.Description: If enabled, REL_SE will not spawn loots in chests having a unique loot.

Settings.Name: Clear container's gear if duplicated
Settings.Description: If enabled, REL_SE will wipe any item added by the vanilla treasure table but has been dropped by REL_SE before to ensure every item you pick up is unique.

Settings.Name: Return an item of equal rarity for every deleted item above
Allow duplicate items
Settings.Description: If enabled, REL_SE will not remove generated items from the general pool, allowing them to maybe appear again.

Settings.Name: Set number of rolls
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: % penalty per successful roll
Settings.Description: If >0, impose rate penalty for each roll after a successfull one.

Settings.Name: Force different item type
Settings.Description:
If enabled, subsequent successive loot rolls will generate an item of different type than 
those before, so you won't have 2 or more gears of the same type per loot container.

Settings.Name: Gear rate multiplier on bosses
Settings.Description: Scales the boss drop rate by this number (boss drop rates uses vanilla rates in General tab

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: Set number of rolls
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll

Settings.Name: Gear rate multiplier on bosses
Settings.Description: Scales the mob drop rate by this number (mob drop rates uses vanilla rates in General tab

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: Enable Trader Shuffle
Settings.Description:
Enable to allow traders to shuffle gears on sale for other gears, removed items are added back to REL_SE pool.
 Only targets unique items

Settings.Name: Enable randomized shuffle
Settings.Description: When disabled, items shuffling will retain rarity distribution, when enabled, will draw items according to global rates scaled to 100%

Settings.Name: Long Rest shuffle amount
Settings.Description: How much of the trader gear is shuffled per long rest, 100% means all of it, 0 means disabled.

Settings.Name: Short Rest shuffle amount
Settings.Description: How much of the trader gear is shuffled per short rest, 100% means all of it, 0 means disabled.

Settings.Name: Includes original gear items
Settings.Description: By default shuffling will avoid trader items appearing on first iteraction, enable this to include them too

Settings.Name: Includes sold gears
Settings.Description: Add gears you sold to traders into shuffling list

Settings.Name: Includes non-unique gears
Settings.Description: Add non-unique gears into shuffling list

Settings.Name: Set number of rolls
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: % penalty per successful roll
Settings.Description: If >0, impose rate penalty for each roll after a successfull one.

Settings.Name: Force different item type
Settings.Description:
If enabled, subsequent successive loot rolls will generate an item of different type than 
those before, so you won't have 2 or more gears of the same type per loot container.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: Enable setting
Settings.Description: Enable 3 categories of drop rates based on chest name by quality: poor, ok and good.

Settings.Name: Poor quality chest, very rare rate
Ok quality chest, very rare rate
Good quality chest, very rare rate

Settings.Name: Force different item type

If enabled, subsequent successive loot rolls will generate an item of different type than 
those before, so you won't have 2 or more gears of the same type per loot container.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied. Use if chest specific is not defined

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: Cosmetic drop rate
Settings.Description:
The general chance of dropping a cosmetic item while looting. 

This is reduced for chests, and is indenpendent from other drop rates

Settings.Name: Make cosmetic items unique
Settings.Description:
If enabled, each cosmetic itemss can only be obtained once. Any item removed from the pool 

 while having this enabled won't return if you disable it after.

Settings.Name: Set number of rolls
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: % penalty per successful roll
Settings.Description: If >0, impose rate penalty for each roll after a successfull one.

Settings.Name: Set number of rolls
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: % penalty per successful roll
Settings.Description: If >0, impose rate penalty for each roll after a successfull one.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: Consecutive Rate Multiplier for potion
Settings.Description: If not 0, this option decreases the subsequent chances of acquiring a potion after each successful drop per chest.

Settings.Name: Configure relative rarity of healing potions
Settings.Description:
Adjust the rarity of healing potions, 25 means a potion has 25% chance of being healing potion, 
 and 75% chance of being any other potion of the rolled tier.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: Consecutive Rate Multiplier for scrolls
Settings.Description: If not 0, this option decreases the subsequent chances of acquiring a scroll after each successful drop per chest.

Settings.Name: Number of possible arrows
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: Consecutive Rate Multiplier for arrows
Settings.Description: If not 0, this option decreases the subsequent chances of acquiring an arrow after each successful drop per chest.

Settings.Name: Enable Randomized Chance
Settings.Description: Enable randomization of drop rates, set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Minimum scale
Settings.Description: The minimum drop rate after randomization, scale to <original drop rate>*(1+min).

Settings.Name: Maximum scale
Settings.Description: The maximum drop rate after randomization, scale to <original drop rate>*(1+max).

Settings.Name: Enable scaling
Settings.Description: Enable to scale the drop rates down/up so their sum matches the setting below.

Settings.Name: Sum for scale of drop rates
Settings.Description:
The target sum of all drop rates after randomization, if you have maxTotal = 50 and your 

randomized drop rates amount to 100, all rates will be slashed down by half.

Settings.Name: Enable Weighted Drop
Settings.Description:
Customize drop rate for each item type. If unchecked, the mod will randomly 

 pull an item of any type, regardless of the overall distribuion

Settings.Name: Go Ham mode
Settings.Description:
Whether to use "chest" filter. If a value selected, the script will apply given settings to ANYTHING it 

 considers a Container, including bags, both vanilla and modded.

Settings.Name: Set number of rolls
Settings.Description: Number of Roll, will stop on a failed roll.

Settings.Name: Ignore failed roll
Settings.Description: If enabled, the failed roll check is ignored, allowing you to roll as manu times as the setting above set regardless of each roll result.

Settings.Name: % penalty per successful roll
Settings.Description: If >0, impose rate penalty for each roll after a successfull one.

Settings.Name: Force different item type
Settings.Description:
If enabled, subsequent successive loot rolls will generate an item of different type than 
those before, so you won't have 2 or more gears of the same type per loot container.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: % rate applied to global setting
Settings.Description: 0 mean -> no drop, 100 -> global settings applied.

Settings.Name: Exclusion List
Settings.Description: Containers in this list are ignored by the mod.

Settings.Name: Rerolling price
Settings.Description: The cost of bribing Withers to bring back the (dead) chance of getting an item from a used chest.

Settings.Name: Enable Gacha-like Pity System
Settings.Description:
If enabled, you are guaranteed a legendary item with enough non-legendary results configured below. The counter is reset on obtaining a legendary item, 
 regardless of whether Pity has activated.

Settings.Name: Number of non-legendary results before pity is activated
Enable Ritual
Settings.Description:
Enable sacrificing a number of items of the same rarity to guarantee 

 an item 1 tier above the sacrificed items.

Settings.Name: Numer of required sacrifices
Settings.Description: The exact total number of items needed to initiate the ritual

Settings.Name: Enable deity-based save scumming countermeasures
Settings.Description:
You get punished for save scumming to reroll for another item. The severity of the punishment is scaled linearly by the number of items you have 
rolled in the current save versus the number of items you have rolled in the save you're about to load. Not all of the punishments are scaled.

Settings.Name: Countermeasure timer
Settings.Description: The duration save-scumming countermeasure is active, counting on done loading a save.

Settings.Name: Enable deity-based insurance policy
Settings.Description:
You get an insurance contract for deliberately dropping you total chance of getting an item 

in a chest to 20% or less. You receive a payout when you get nothing from a container/corpse. The magnitude of the insurance payout is scaled 
linearly by how much percentage you would go beyond 20% (such as 15%, 10% or less). Not all of the payouts are scaled

Settings.Name: Disable notifications
Settings.Description:
By default message boxes will appear when you trigger a punishment/payout to give context 

and clues of why you receive them, set to 1 to turn them off.

Settings.Name: Loot Dispensing Aura
Settings.Description:
DO NOT ENABLE IF YOU DON"T HAVE AUTO LOOT AURA 

 This will have the script piggyback on Auto Loot Aura Mod and automatically distribute loots 

 to eligible containers, depending on your rates settings.

Settings.Name: Load/save/loot optimization
Settings.Description: Enable if you encounter lag during loot generation, loading and saving the game.
